If animals grew to twice their size, it would change the entire ecosystem as we know it. Larger animals would require more resources and space, potentially leading to overpopulation in certain areas.
It could also impact the food chain, as larger animals would require larger prey, potentially leading to the extinction of smaller species.
Larger animals could also pose a threat to humans, as they could become more aggressive or territorial.
Larger animals could potentially have a longer lifespan, as they would be able to withstand more physical stress.
It could also lead to new species of animals that would be able to adapt to the new environment, potentially leading to new and exciting discoveries in the animal kingdom.
